pr_title: wappalyzer: Add support for Dom inspection/patterns

timeline.message:
wappalyzer: Add support for Dom inspection

Signed-off-by: nikolai6303 <iit2018152@iiita.ac.in>

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not sure this is going to work properly, I suspect that too many messages will be matched because the assembled property pattern won't match as specifically as the whole DOM selector.
Note I haven't tested IRL, that's just based on reading.
timeline.author: kingthorin

timeline.bodyText: Please restore this to not use a wildcard import.
timeline.author: kingthorin

timeline.bodyText: It would be better to pass in HttpMessage msg, then use msg.getResponseBody().toString().
timeline.author: kingthorin

replies.author: kingthorin

timeline.bodyText:
Could you make the variable names a bit more meaningful here? Ex:

map ➡️ domSelectorMap
link & links ➡️ selectedElement & selectedElements
etc
timeline.author: kingthorin

timeline.bodyText: Can be removed?
timeline.author: kingthorin

timeline.bodyText: Throughout, could you remove the blank lines leading the comments?
timeline.author: kingthorin

timeline.bodyText: If the pattern selector defines both, shouldn't both be required for a match?
timeline.author: kingthorin
kingthorin

timeline.bodyText: Could you make the variable names in here a bit more meaningful as well?
timeline.author: kingthorin

timeline.bodyText: This seems to be unused.
timeline.author: kingthorin

timeline.bodyText: I just meant the commented line.
timeline.author: kingthorin

replies.bodyText: Made changes in the previous commit itself.
replies.author: bettercalln1ck

timeline.bodyText: Source is no longer necessary here, right?
timeline.author: kingthorin

replies.bodyText: I have made changes in the previous commit itself.
replies.author: bettercalln1ck

replies.bodyText: There only one dom selector having properties in apps.json and I can't seem to find any example for it.
replies.author: bettercalln1ck

replies.bodyText: Check the upstream linked earlier for examples, or just make something up.
replies.author: kingthorin

replies.bodyText:
Jsoup is not able to extract react-dom properties. Can you suggest a fix for that?
Maybe some other library.
replies.author: bettercalln1ck

replies.bodyText: Jsoup is unable to access "_reactRootContainer" property of "body > div"
replies.author: bettercalln1ck

replies.bodyText: Can I use selenium for detecting property?
